Ice::

She smiled as she found that she could pick him up. "OK, I'll quit." 
she stopped thinking about trying to pick him up and let the hold 
onhim go. She frowned as he told her to go take a nap. "But I'm not 
tired." She watched him leave the room. She sighed and transformed 
into polar bear mode and walked over to the corner. She layed downa 
nd rested her head on her front paws. She was bored and restless.  
She closed her eyes and thought about maike the chair lift up off the 
floor. She opened her eyes and saw it floating. She smiled. She 
concentrated and help the chair up, then she picked up a pen and 
started to write something while on paper while it was at the 
computer console. She had the pen going, writing her thoguht, the 
chair in the air. She wanted to see that else she could do. She 
picked up a small flash light and had it turning on and off. She 
smiled. "Yes,  I think I shall have this ability mastered in no time 
at all."




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> 
> Veratis felt himself tremble as he was lifted off the ground. "Put 
me down,
> I'm busy here." He reached back to give her a tap and noticed she 
wasn't
> there. He looked back and saw her concentration. "What are you 
doing?" he
> transformed to bat mode and started to flap his wings. he flew 
higher then
> behind her to land. "You'll never gain control if you keep 
playing." He'd
> suspected this possability since she started moving her 
protoform. "Now go
> take a nap and I'll get back to you in the morning." Hetransformed 
back to
> robot mode stepped back to his computer and went back to work.
> 
> "Such disrespect for her creator humph." he thought, "Lady Hawk 
would've
> never shown such disrespect to me."
> 
> In the makeshift training room Lunarpine and Foxfingers traded 
barbs and
> tags as they worked. A call came through over the link. "Time for a 
little
> Rejuvination." Veratis' voice chimed in a commanding way to the two 
bots.
> Lunarpine stopped running as he listened. Foxfingers lunged forward 
trying
> to take advantage of the wolfs vulnerable state. Lunarpine spun and 
caught
> the fox in mid leap. "Nice try Fox, to bad I'm just a little to 
smart for
> that. Foxfingers transformed back to robot mode, "Look down." 
Lunarpine did
> as the fox requested and saw a detonator attached to his 
waist. "Tag Wolfy"
> the fox taunted "I win." Lunarpine dropped the fox pestered by the
> detonator. He pulled it off and tossed it back to the fox. "Not to 
bad, I'll
> know better next time." he left the room and proceeded to the 
quarters that
> Veratis had assigned to him. Foxfingers returned to his and retired 
for the
> night.
> 
> Veratis stretched his wings again as he stepped in his chamber. 
He'd been
> working far to much for an old bot, he needed rest badly, He'd have 
plenty
> of time to work in the morning. He looked back toward the lab 
remembering
> the samples Foxfingers had brought from the maximals. He still 
didn't know
> about the fox's adventure in the Predacon base. He thought about 
Lady Hawk,
> wherever she was she was in trouble or she'd have returned by now.
